title: An Outstanding Collection of Flair Alphabets
content:
A [Flickr set](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011125953/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/el_wombato/sets/72157612959007610/) of a small specimen book I found a few months back. Includes flaired Cooper and Univers, among others.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011125953im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cooperflair_5832.png)
author: bongo

comments.content: This is a great example of what people are talking about when they say that plenty of the photo-lettering alphabets should never be revived. And I learned that Bodidot is a classification! That’s right up there with “Garaldine”.

The specimens tend to be a bit over the top, as they are required to show as many swashes as possible.  
Sure, a lot of typographers got carried away, but there were many lovely examples of flairing.  
Canada Type has done a nice revival of [Goudy Flair.](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011125953/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/goudy-two-shoes/)
